summary: A synagogue is a place where Jews meet to worship and pray to God.
full_text:
Beth Midrash  refers to a Jewish study hall located in a synagogue, yeshiva, kollel or other building. It is distinct from a synagogue, although many synagogues are also used as batei midrash and vice versa.
"Beis midrash" is also the name of the undergraduate-level program in Orthodox yeshivas in the United States, for boys over 12th grade.
The Arabic term "Madrasah" is derived from the same Semitic root and refers to any type of educational institution.
title: Beth midrash
